intro: Parsonsia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas flameflower, is a striking tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from orange to red, often with contrasting yellow or white markings. Its leaves are typically ovate and arranged oppositely along the stem. Parsonsia chiapensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial to full sunlight.
